metadata.title: Texas A&M University System Security Control Standards Catalog

party.name: Texas A&M University System Office of Cybersecurity

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Ensure users with privileged (also known as administrative or special access) accounts are aware of the extraordinary responsibilities associated with the use of privileged accounts.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Implement role-based (e.g., students, employees, third parties, guests) access control or adopt an InCommon Federation assurance profile roles, where possible.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Publish a privacy notice on websites owned by the organization which contains, at a minimum, the content contained on or a link to the Texas A&M University System online privacy standard at https://cyber-standards.tamus.edu/privacy-standard.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Require the implementation of a mobile device management (MDM) product on all organization-controlled mobile devices.

part.name: item
part.p: Incorporate change management processes to ensure secure, reliable, and stable operations to which all offices that support information systems adhere. Ensure the change management process incorporates guidelines that address:

part.name: item
part.p: formally identifying, classifying, prioritizing, and requesting changes;

part.name: item
part.p: identifying and deploying emergency changes;

part.name: item
part.p: assessing potential impacts from changes;

part.name: item
part.p: authorizing changes and exceptions, and

part.name: item
part.p: implementing changes and planning for back-outs.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Adopt baseline security configuration checklists that meet or exceed published industry best practice sources (e.g., Center for Internet Security Benchmarks [CIS Benchmarks], NIST National Checklist Program [NCP]) when available, or locally develop security configuration checklists otherwise, for all organization-owned or -managed major and high-impact information systems, and systems processing confidential information.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Inform users that unauthorized or unlicensed use of software is regarded as a serious matter subject to disciplinary action.

part.name: item
part.p: Users may not install applications which capture indiscriminate input from a human interface device such as a keyboard.

part.name: item
part.p: Applications designed to capture discriminate input are not in scope of this control standard if the application meets the following criteria:

part.name: item
part.p: The application behavior is explicitly approved by the user on a per-application basis;

part.name: item
part.p: The application does not run at the operating system level, and

part.name: item
part.p: The application does not capture indiscriminate input from a web browser.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Develop information resources contingency plans that align with the member’s emergency management plan as required by Texas A&M System Regulation 34.07.01, Emergency Management.

part.name: item
part.p: Test the contingency plan at least annually through a tabletop exercise, and

part.name: item
part.p: Test the contingency plan at least every three years with a full interruption of high-impact, on-premise services.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Include information resources contingency plan testing in the member’s emergency management plan testing and exercises.

set-parameter.label: information systems that process and/or store sensitive or high-impact information

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Protect with a backup strategy which uses immutable backup storage and/or an out-of-band backup process that prevents direct access to backup storage from the organization's production networks.

part.name: item
part.p: Employ the use of multi-factor authentication on information resources containing information categorized as Confidential under A&M System Catalog control RA-2 to ensure that only appropriate individuals have access to confidential information, and

part.name: item
part.p: Approve requests for exceptions in advance and report exceptions to the SCISO annually.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Limit the lifetime of browser cookies used for binding authenticated sessions to organization-owned or -managed information systems to no more than five (5) days.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Report information security incidents where the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of a moderate or high-impact organization-owned or -operated information system, or a system processing confidential information, is potentially compromised to the Texas A&M University System Cybersecurity Operations Center using the guidance in the Incident Notification Process, unless a law enforcement agency determines such a notification will impede a criminal investigation.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Mark, physically or electronically, removable electronic media and information resources output containing sensitive personal information [TxBCC 521.002] by indicating the ownership, distribution limitations, handling caveats, and applicable data categorizations.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Ensure audio-visual surveillance technology used to monitor physical access to information systems is used responsibly and within the intended scope of the purpose for such deployment, and transparent processes and controls are implemented for the use of such technology and any resulting recorded material.

part.name: item
part.p: Consolidate all significant IT equipment into centralized member data center(s) or approved commercial data center.

part.name: item
part.p: The data center must have, at a minimum:

part.name: item
part.p: redundant power delivery as specified in PE-11;

part.name: item
part.p: redundant networks as specified in CP-8;

part.name: item
part.p: redundant cooling as specified in PE-14, and

part.name: item
part.p: adequate physical and cybersecurity as specified in the PE and SC families.
and may also provide:

part.name: item
part.p: operating system setup and administration (including virtualized);

part.name: item
part.p: backup and recovery;

part.name: item
part.p: storage management;

part.name: item
part.p: configuration and patch management, and

part.name: item
part.p: other managed services.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Ensure rules of behavior incorporate Texas A&M System Policy 33.04, Use of System Resources, and the organization's acceptable use guidelines.

part.name: item
part.p: Designate a single system of record for inventory of all information systems [SP 800-171] and network-attached operational technology [SP 800-37] owned or managed by the member;

part.name: item
part.p: Include any cloud computing services [SP 800-145] operated by the member in the inventory of organizational systems, and

part.name: item
part.p: Designate which data regarding an information system to record in the inventory of information systems. At a minimum, the data includes a unique identifier (e.g., serial number or system name), owner, custodian, description of the information system's function or major application, and highest level of data categorization stored/processed on the information system.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Ensure an IT organization is designated to provide security monitoring for all information systems, in both centralized and decentralized IT environments, owned or managed by the organization.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Reduce, and eliminate where possible, the collection and/or use of sensitive personal information [TxBCC 521.002] in information resources under the control of the organization.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Categorize information and information systems owned or managed by the organization using a data categorization structure that incorporates the guidance provided in the Texas A&M System Data Categorization Standard, at a minimum.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: The member information security officer reviews the data security requirements and specifications of any new information systems or services that process and/or store sensitive or high-impact information.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: The member information security officer:

part.name: item
part.p: Reviews and approves the security requirements in acquisition contracts of any new information system that processes and/or stores sensitive or high-impact information prior to the member procuring the system or service, and

part.name: item
part.p: Ensures acquisition contracts for information systems, system components, or information system services address information security, backup, and privacy requirements.

part.name: item
part.p: Such contracts should include right-to-audit and other provisions to provide appropriate assurance that applications and information are adequately protected.

part.name: item
part.p: Vendors and third parties adhere to all state and Federal laws and System policies pertaining to the protection of information resources and privacy of sensitive information.

part.name: tamus_implementation
part.p: Monitor information resources in accordance with Texas A&M System Policy 29.01, Information Resources.

citation.text: Texas Business and Commerce Code Section 521.002, Unauthorized Use of Identifying Information: Definitions
Texas Security Control Standards Catalog, Version 2.1
Texas A&M University System Policy 29.01, Information Resources
Texas A&M System Regulation 29.01.03, Information Security
Texas A&M University System Policy 33.04, Use of System Resources
Texas A&M System Regulation 34.07.01, Emergency Management Plans
Mell P, Grance T (2011) The NIST Definition of Cloud Computing. (National Institute of Standards and Technology, Gaithersburg, MD), NIST Special Publication (SP) 800-145.
